Installation view of ArtNow: Materials and Boundaries. Photo: Blake Studdard

Now on view

ArtNow: Materials and Boundaries The 2025 edition of ArtNow highlights new and recent art from 26 artists active in the state. The exhibition explores identity, place and experimentation through boundary-pushing practices and material innovation.

  • ArtNow: Materials and Boundaries | Gallery Talks

    Oct. 2, Nov. 13, Dec. 4 and Jan. 15, 6-8 p.m.

    Eleanor Kirkpatrick Main Gallery

  • Jakian Parks: The Black Land

    Explore photography that connects the past and present, situating the American West as a living archive and center stage for Black cattlemen and cowboys alike. Through Parks’ lens, The Black Land honors Black equestrian life as a living tradition of cultural and historical significance.

    More +

  • Neufs for Oklahoma Autumn

    This site-specific work presents an intriguing installment in Heap of Birds’s ongoing Neuf series in the form of hand-painted, public basketball courts, shedding light on the importance of these lesser-known abstract acrylic paintings.

    More +

  • Read. Sip. Shop.

    Whether you're looking for a gift for an artistic friend or a design-forward treat for yourself, Shop Contemporary has you covered. From stickers and books to home decor and more, there's something for everyone.

    More +

  • Become a Member

    There's never been a better time to join Oklahoma Contemporary. Your support helps to guarantee accessible art for audiences of all kinds — and there are some nice perks for you, too, including early access and discounts on Studio School registration. Photo: AJ Stegall.

    More +
